body.p: XHTML stands for W3C Extensible HyperText Markup Language. XHTML is aimed to replace HTML. While almost identical to HTML 5, XHTML is a stricter and cleaner version of HTML. XHTML is HTML defined as an XML application.
This sample shows that <oXygen/> can be used to edit XHTML documents. XHTML is a W3C standard.

And here is the <oXygen/> home site http://www.oxygenxml.com/
With oXygen you can insert and play audio and video clips in the Author page of an XHTML document.
When you place the mouse cursor right above the first table column, the cursor is changed and the column under the mouse cursor is highlighted. If you click, the column is selected.
If you place the mouse cursor in the left side of the first table row, the cursor is changed and the row placed to the right of the mouse cursor is highlighted. If you click, the row is selected.
To select the entire table click the top-left corner of the table.
The column widths can be adjusted by dragging the column margins.
Drag and drop, cut, and copy operations are available on XHTML tables.
The built-in XHTML support in oXygen includes a large set of operations and functionality. However, there are situations in which you must extend this set to match particular requirements.
The oXygen Author SDK for JAVA developers allows you to add custom Author actions and extensions for the Author visual mode of oXygen XML Editor.
